thread.title: Conway Denies CNN’s Claim She Was Put On the Shelf After Rough Week
thread.title_full: Conway Denies CNN’s Claim She Was Put On the Shelf After Rough Week

author: Jack Davis
title: Conway Denies CNN’s Claim She Was Put On the Shelf After Rough Week
text:
— Sean Hannity (@seanhannity) February 22, 2017 
CNN, however, stood by its report. Alas, it is true. She hasn’t been on TV for over a week. Fact they might put her back on TV at some point doesn’t change that. https://t.co/jlSoixx5Fc 
— Dylan Byers (@DylanByers) February 22, 2017 Advertisement – story continues below 
Noting that Conway has not given a TV interview since early last week, CNN reported on Wednesday that anonymous White House sources said Conway is not appearing on TV to give last week’s controversy time to fade. 
“Trump was using her as an effective surrogate, then she started becoming ineffective,” CNN reported one of its anonymous sources as saying. “So they’re letting the heat cool off.” 
Hours before Flynn resigned last Monday, Conway had said Flynn had President Donald Trump’s “full confidence.” She then said Flynn offered to go, but was later corrected by White House Press Secretary Sean Spicer who said Trump asked Flynn to step down. As a result the MSNBC show Morning Joe banned her and questioned her credibility. Advertisement - story continues below
